H0.text: Communities are the groups in which ecological succession refers to the change in the numbers and types of species that live.

H1.text: Movements are the groups in which ecological succession refers to the change in the numbers and types of species that live.

H2.text: Colonies are the groups in which ecological succession refers to the change in the numbers and types of species that live.

H3.text: Biomes are the groups in which ecological succession refers to the change in the numbers and types of species that live.

A4.text: Ecological succession is the process of how species compositions change in an ecological community over time.
